title: Coral
info: A piano piece inspired by the soundtrack from the video game Superliminal.
priceNotes: Price = Score x Parts = (Length) x (# of Instruments)

title: Rabbit Rondo
info: As the name suggests, "Rabbit Rondo" is a piece about...rabbits - particularly how much they hop around - and expressed in three different characters.

title: The Wayfarer
info: "The Wayfarer" is a three-movement suite for flute, clarinet, and bassoon that follows a character's journey through different experiences. The original piece was written in 2019 and revised in 2024.
priceNotes: Price = Score x Parts = (Length) x (# of Instruments)

title: Two Pieces for Wind Quintet
info: Two Pieces for Wind Quintet is a set of two pieces inspired by Amy Beach's "Suite for Two Pianos." "Confusion" is a chromatically wandering perpetuum mobile while "Sarcasm" is a reaction to the excessive accidentals in the previous piece.
priceNotes: Price = Score x Parts = (Length) x (# of Instruments)

title: on a warm evening
info: "on a warm evening" is a chamber orchestra piece that evokes the experience of sitting on a front porch, watching the sun set on a hot, humid summer evening. This piece was written for the Albany Symphony's "Dogs of Desire" ensemble.
priceNotes: Price = Score x Parts = (Length) x (# of Instruments)

title: Dandelion
info: "Dandelion" is a short piano piece inspired by the experience of seeing dandelions blooming outside my apartment while practicing Debussy’s Prelude No. 5 from Book I, “Les collines d’Anacapri.”
priceNotes: Price = Score x Parts = (Length) x (# of Instruments)

title: Beryl
info: Written during the power outage post-Hurricane Beryl, whose path went right over our house.
priceNotes: Price = Score x Parts = (Length) x (# of Instruments)

title: Amber
info: A piano piece inspired by the soundtrack from the video game Superliminal.
priceNotes: Price = Score x Parts = (Length) x (# of Instruments)

title: liminal
info: liminal explores the concept of transitional spaces which can seem comforting on the surface, but can also be unsettling after a prolonged amount of time. the piece takes inspiration from the “untitled goose game” (which uses a selection of pieces from debussy’s les preludes) and “superliminal” (matt christensen).
priceNotes: Price = Score x Parts = (Length) x (# of Instruments)

title: Horizon
info: "Horizon" is a short piece composed for my friend’s middle school beginner orchestra (grade 0.5). It aims to use the fundamental concepts beginner orchestra students learn, but in ways that feel engaging and fresh.

title: Auld Lang Syne
info: An arrangement of Auld Lang Syne for English Horn, Alto Saxophone, Glockenspiel, Piano, and Double Bass.
